name: bloodletting

[ U ] formal killing and violence, especially between enemy groups involved in an argument that has existed for a long time: ethnic bloodletting
[ S or U ] the situation in which a company reduces the number of people working for it: EWS carried out further bloodletting by sacking some senior employees.
[ U ] in the past, a medical treatment in which blood was taken from a person who wasill

WORKPLACE
  informal a process in which a company with financial problems gets rid of a lot of employees at the same time: Twenty-five senior employees were fired in the latest round of bloodletting.
STOCK MARKET a period of time during which shares lose a lot of their value: Wall Street prepared itself for a week of bloodletting as stock market conditions continued to worsen.
